009
010package imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterScalarSeparable;
015import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.GaussianKernel1D;
016import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
017
018/**
019 * <p>
020 * Scalar and separable version of the Bilateral filter as proposed in [1].
021 * On color images, this filter is applied separately to each color component.
022 * The filter uses Gaussian domain and range kernels and can be applied to all 
023 * image types. See Sec. 17.2 of [2] for additional details.
024 * </p>
025 * <p>
026 * [1] C. Tomasi and R. Manduchi, "Bilateral Filtering for Gray and Color Images",
027 * Proceedings of the 1998 IEEE International Conference on Computer Vision,
028 * Bombay, India.
029 * <br>
030 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 
031 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
032 * </p>
033 * 
034 * @author W. Burger
035 * @version 2021/01/01
036 */
037public class BilateralFilterScalarSeparable extends GenericFilterScalarSeparable implements BilateralF {
038        
039        private final float[] Hd;       // the 1D domain kernel
040        private final int K;            // the domain kernel size [-K,...,K]
041        private final double sigmaR2;
042        
043        public BilateralFilterScalarSeparable() {
044                this(new Parameters());
045        }
046        
047        public BilateralFilterScalarSeparable(Parameters params) {
048                GaussianKernel1D kernel = new GaussianKernel1D(params.sigmaD);
049                this.Hd = kernel.getH();
050                this.K = kernel.getXc();
051                this.sigmaR2 = sqr(params.sigmaR);
052        }
053        
054        // 1D filter in x-direction
055        @Override
056        protected float doPixelX(PixelSlice source, int u, int v) {
057                return filterXY(source, u, v, true);
058        }
059        
060        // 1D filter in y-direction
061        @Override
062        protected float doPixelY(PixelSlice source, int u, int v) {
063                return filterXY(source, u, v, false);
064        }
065        
066        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
067        
068        private float filterXY(PixelSlice source, int u, int v, boolean isX) {
069                float a = source.getVal(u, v);
070                float S = 0;
071                float W = 0;
072                for (int m = -K; m <= K; m++) {
073                        float b = (isX) ? source.getVal(u + m, v) : source.getVal(u, v + m);
074                        float wd = Hd[m + K];                           // domain weight
075                        float wr = gauss(a - b, sigmaR2);       // range weight
076                        float w = wd * wr;
077                        S = S + w * b;
078                        W = W + w;
079                }
080                return S / W;
081        }
082        
083        private float gauss(double x, double sigma2) {
084                return (float) Math.exp(-(x * x) / (2 * sigma2));
085        }
086        
087}
